meanings.definition: To depose or remove from the position of pope.
meanings.sent1: The council decided to unpope the controversial leader.
meanings.sent2: The cardinals voted to unpope the pope due to his misconduct.
meanings.sent3: It would be quite a scandal if they tried to unpope the pope during the ceremony.
meanings.sent4: The decision to unpope the pope sent shockwaves through the Vatican.
meanings.sent5: The act to unpope a pope is a rare and significant event in history.

meanings.definition: Not being or becoming a pope.
meanings.sent1: He was an unpope candidate for the papal election.
meanings.sent2: The unpope individuals were not considered for the position.
meanings.sent3: It was a relief for him to be an unpope member of the clergy.
meanings.sent4: She felt content in her unpope status within the church.
meanings.sent5: The unpope candidates had their own unique roles in the church community.
